author: Staff Reporter
text:
Dalit Liberation Movement- Tamil Nadu has petitioned Chief Minister and Collector seeking their intervention to recover 1,623 acre of land belonging to seven temples in the district from the illegal possession of some unauthorised persons.

S. Karuppaiah, state joint general secretary of the Movement, said the lands, once recovered, should be distributed to landless Dalit people and also to people who were economically weak.

He alleged in the memorandum that unauthorised persons had encroached upon the said lands over a period of time and utilised the same for their benefits.

“Some have started agriculture and others even constructed buildings”, he accused.

According to him, the encroachments have happened in lands at Muthur, Uthamapalayam, Kannapuram, Mayilarangam, Valliarasal, Vellakoil and Lakkamanaickenpatti.
title: Dalit Liberation Movement plea to CM
